ImageCapture.summary: The ImageCapture interface of the MediaStream Image Capture API provides methods to enable the capture of images or photos from a camera or other photographic device. It provides an interface for capturing images from a photographic device referenced through a valid .

ImageCaptureGetPhotoCapabilities.summary:
The getPhotoCapabilities()
method of the interface returns a {{jsxref("Promise")}}
that resolves with an object containing the ranges of
available configuration options.
ImageCaptureGetPhotoCapabilities.returns: A that resolves with an object containing the following properties:

ImageCaptureGetPhotoSettings.summary:
The getPhotoSettings() method of
the interface returns a {{jsxref("Promise")}} that
resolves with an object containing the current photo
configuration settings.
ImageCaptureGetPhotoSettings.returns: A that resolves with an object containing the following properties:

ImageCaptureGrabFrame.summary:
The grabFrame() method of the
interface takes a snapshot of the live video in a
and returns a {{jsxref("Promise")}} that resolves with
an containing the snapshot.
ImageCaptureGrabFrame.returns: A {{jsxref("Promise")}} that resolves to an object.

ImageCaptureImageCapture.summary:
The ImageCapture() constructor
creates a new object.
ImageCaptureImageCapture.returns:
A new ImageCapture object which can be used to capture still frames from
the specified video track.

ImageCaptureTakePhoto.summary:
The takePhoto() method of the
interface takes a single exposure using the video capture
device sourcing a and returns a {{jsxref("Promise")}}
that resolves with a containing the data.

ImageCaptureTrack.summary:
The track read-only property of the
interface returns a reference to the
passed to the
constructor.
